TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed StringModule extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Functional programming operators for string processing. Further string operations are available via the member functions on strings and other functionality in System.String and System.Text.RegularExpressions types.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Collect (Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc<char,string> mapping, string str);
.method public static string Collect(class Microsoft.FSharp.Core.FSharpFunc`2<char, string> mapping, string str) cil managed
Public Shared Function Collect (mapping As FSharpFunc(Of Char, String), str As String) As String
Microsoft.FSharp.Core.String.collect : (char -> string) -> string -> string

Docs.param: The function to produce a string from each character of the input string.
The input string.
Docs.summary: Builds a new string whose characters are the results of applying the function mapping to each of the characters of the input string and concatenating the resulting strings.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Concat (string sep, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> strings);
.method public static string Concat(string sep, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> strings) cil managed
Public Shared Function Concat (sep As String, strings As IEnumerable(Of String)) As String
Microsoft.FSharp.Core.String.concat : string -> seq<string> -> string

Docs.param: The separator string to be inserted between the strings of the input sequence.
The sequence of strings to be concatenated.
Docs.summary: Returns a new string made by concatenating the given strings with separator sep, that is a1 + sep + ... + sep + aN.
Docs.returns: A new string consisting of the concatenated strings separated by the separation string.

Microsoft.FSharp.Core.String.exists : (char -> bool) -> string -> bool

Docs.param: The function to test each character of the string.
The input string.
Docs.summary: Tests if any character of the string satisfies the given predicate.
Docs.returns: True if any character returns true for the predicate and false otherwise.

Microsoft.FSharp.Core.String.filter : (char -> bool) -> string -> string

Docs.param: A function to test whether each character in the input sequence should be included in the output string.
The input string.
Docs.summary: Builds a new string containing only the characters of the input string for which the given predicate returns "true".
Docs.remarks: Returns an empty string if the input string is null

Docs.param: The function to test each character of the string.
The input string.
Docs.summary: Tests if all characters in the string satisfy the given predicate.
Docs.returns: True if all characters return true for the predicate and false otherwise.

Docs.param: The number of strings to initialize.
The function to take an index and produce a string to be concatenated with the others.
Docs.summary: Builds a new string whose characters are the results of applying the function mapping to each index from 0 to count-1 and concatenating the resulting strings.

Docs.param: The function to be applied to each character of the string.
The input string.
Docs.summary: Applies the function action to each character in the string.
